parameters.name: properties
parameters.description: Sets all key-value pairs in the properties object as widget properties.

description: An `AlertDialog` represents a native dialog pop-up showing a message and up to three buttons.  Is automatically disposed when closed.

message.description: The message to display inside the dialog.

buttons.description: An object with the texts of the buttons to display. There are up to three buttons: `ok`, `cancel` and `neutral`. If no text is given for a button it will not be displayed. Example: `{ok: 'Yes', cancel: 'No'}` shows 'Yes' and 'No', but no 'neutral' button.

close.description: Fired when the dialog was closed for any reason.

button.description: The type of button that was used to close the dialog. Can also be an empty string, e.g. when the global back button was pressed.

closeOk.description: Fired when the dialog was closed by pressing the 'ok' button.

closeCancel.description: Fired when the dialog was closed by pressing the 'cancel' button.

closeNeutral.description: Fired when the dialog was closed by pressing the 'neutral' button.
